title: US Man Sues Ex-Wife's Lover Under 'Homewrecker Law' & Wins More Than Rs 5 Crore
text:
A US man won a whopping Rs 5.3 crore ($7,50,000) after he decided to sue his estranged wife's lover under 'homewrecker law.'

For the uninitiated, 'homewrecker law' is still valid in seven states across the US and it effectively allows a spouse to sue anyone who may have played a part in ending their marriage.

Twitter/Picture For Representation

This report defines the basis of the law as, 'a man “owned” his wife’s affection, and so if someone “stole” it away then they would be legally responsible.' Under this law, the ''homewrecker' doesn't have to be a lover but anyone who interferes (including family members) in the marriage.

So the law is valid for all those who hail from Hawaii, Illinois, New Mexico, North Carolina, Mississippi, South Dakota, and Utah.

According to CBS , Kevin Howard was married 12 years when his wife approached him about separating.

“I filed this case because I believe it’s very important that people understand that sanctity of marriage is important especially in this day and age when people question everyone’s morals, people questions everyone’s liability of a person and the state backed me up on it,” Howard told the CBS.

“He ate dinner with us several times, we spent time together. … I thought this was a friend.” Howard claimed the lawsuit wasn’t just about the money but about a vengeance for the worst possible betrayal.
